questions.question_text: Which two layers of the OSI model are combined in the Internet protocol suite network access layer? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I think they meant to say "Network interface layer". The question (and answers) would make sense then.
This question doesn't even make sense The OSI Network layer is the TCP/IP Internet layer.

questions.question_text: What is the maximum distance that is supported by Cisco passive Twinax cables?

discussion.content: Meant to preface that by saying the answer given (5m) is correct.

This is confirmed correct:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/interfaces-modules/transceiver-modules/data_sheet_c78-455693.html

Search for active Twinax cables in lengths of 7 and 10 meters.

questions.question_text: What is the maximum distance that is supported by Cisco active Twinax cables?

discussion.content: The keyword here is SOURCE. If they had stated it didn't have an entry for the DESTINATION MAC, then the answer would have been FLOODED. But since they specified SOURCE, the answer given is correct.

questions.question_text: If a Nexus switch receives a frame and does not have an entry in its MAC table for the source, which action will take place?

choices.D: The source address will be learned.

discussion.content:
Remember the formula 2^n - 2
So, a /21 leaves 11 host bits (32-21). 

2 to the 11th power is 2048. Then subtract one for the network address and one for the broadcast address.

questions.question_text: How many IP addresses are usable for a subnet that has the address 10.6.128.0/21?
